DEPRECATED!!!!

latnp.array

Latitude values.

radiusfloat

nes.methods.horizontal_interpolation.lon_lat_to_cartesian_ecef(lon, lat)[source]ÔÉÅ

Convert observational/model geographic longitude/latitude coordinates to cartesian ECEF (Earth Centred, Earth Fixed) coordinates, assuming WGS84 datum and ellipsoid, and that all heights = 0. ECEF coordiantes represent positions (in meters) as X, Y, Z coordinates, approximating the earth surface as an ellipsoid of revolution. This conversion is for the subsequent calculation of euclidean distances of the model gridcell centres from each observational station. Defining the distance between two points on the earth‚Äôs surface as simply the euclidean distance between the two lat/lon pairs could lead to inaccurate results depending on the distance between two points (i.e. 1 deg. of longitude varies with latitude).

ParametersÔÉÅ

lonnp.array

Longitude values.

latnp.array

Latitude values.

nes.methods.spatial_join.prepare_external_shapefile(self, ext_shp, var_list, info=False, apply_bbox=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

Prepare the external shapefile.

It is high recommended to pass ext_shp parameter as string because it will clip the external shapefile to the rank.

  1. Read if it is not already read

  2. Filter variables list

  3. Standardize projections

ParametersÔÉÅ

selfnes.Nes

Nes Object.

ext_shpGeoDataFrame or str

External shapefile or path to it.

var_listList[str] or None

External shapefile variables to be computed.

infobool

Indicates if you want to print the information.

apply_bboxbool

Indicates if you want to reduce the shapefile to a bbox.

ReturnsÔÉÅ

GeoDataFrame

External shapefile.

nes.methods.spatial_join.spatial_join(self, ext_shp, method=None, var_list=None, info=False, apply_bbox=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

ParametersÔÉÅ

selfnes.Nes

Nes Object.

ext_shpGeoPandasDataFrame or str

Overlay method. Accepted values: [‚Äònearest‚Äô, ‚Äòintersection‚Äô, ‚Äòcentroid‚Äô].

var_listList or None or str

Variables that will be included in the resulting shapefile.

infobool

Indicates if you want to print the process info.

nes.methods.vertical_interpolation.interpolate_vertical(self, new_levels, new_src_vertical=None, kind='linear', extrapolate=None, info=None, overwrite=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Vertical interpolation.

ParametersÔÉÅ

Source Nes object.

List of new vertical levels.

new_src_verticalnes.Nes, str

kindstr

Vertical methods type.

extrapolateNone, tuple, str

Extrapolate method (for non linear operations).

info: None, bool

Indicates if you want to print extra information.

overwrite: bool
